- I am basically a little
bit of a minimalist.

if this is minil-m, milim,
m-le-lem, me-beli-bem (laughs).
I'm not sure if this is mini-mal.
I'm not sure if I'm a minimalist,

than I actually need, but I
do live out of a backpack,

so I guess that does classify
me as a bit of a minimalist.

what I have, because I

little bit extra, I like to
have quality things with me,

that make me look good,
because I don't want
to look like I am homeless when I travel.
Wif-ou-fura-doo-doo (chuckles).

Here is what I pack as
an extra-minimalist.

So these two bags is basically
what I end up carrying with.

This is a 38 liter,

a carry-on/not carry-on,
and this is my carry-on.

Sometimes I take this one
as a carry-on as well,

if they let me take both,
and sometimes I don't.

Don't know if this
classifies as minimalism
because it is still quite big
and there's still a lot I take.
But the reason I have to have these two

is because I have a lot
of photography gear,
and this takes up the most space.
(fast techno music)
Six dresses, two shorts, six pants,
one which is my warm flying pants.
2.5 bikinis, one workout set, one jumper,
five skirts, six tops, undies,

clean, dirty, bag doubles up
as produce bag, no plastic!
Warm flight socks.

You probably noticed that a
lot of the pieces of clothing

are very solid in color,
a lot of them are black
because they go with a lot of things.
Clearly you can tell
that this is my summer wardrobe as well,
because I have a small storage in Iceland,
where all my winter clothes live,

so whenever summer's around,
I'll just switch them out.
Obviously if you're traveling
through different weather patterns,
it's a lot harder, but I have done it,
exactly the same backpack size.

You just cull more, you
have two pairs of pants,

two jumpers and four
dresses, whatever works

to make sure that you have
enough for both seasons.

Eyeliner, mascara, eyebrow

Menstrual cup, serum,
metal razor, razor blades,

Hairbrush, tweezers, toothbrush,
all make-up and toiletries fit in this.

My life's work, if someone

Headphones, camera, microphone, tripod,

Global converter.

B-12, Vitamin D, when I

Super Greens, always.
Turmeric, Cod Liver Oil.

Super cool, I know.

Closed shoes, also doubles

Epic bag, gratitude journal,

Workout band, I've never used it.

It's weird because now you
have witnessed my entire world.
This is all that I have.
It looks like a lot, but it packs neatly,
compactly into my little bags.
So, I have been traveling a long time,

and I have worked out what
I need and what I don't need

over the years, so this is not
gonna be a solution for you,

it might be completely
different, what you pack.

You might not have the extensive
camera gear that I have,
you might need less clothes than I do,

I have too many clothes, and
I am culling all the time.

I actually kind of use traveling
as an elimination process.

So if I don't wear
something very regularly

or at all, I get rid of
it pretty pretty quickly.

My new purchase today of
this top and these pants,
I'm replacing two items.
I know exactly which ones they are,
I'm just switching them out.

I'm gonna hand them to
charity, someone else will make

great use of them, but for
me it's just time to move on.

And in the end, you end up
with a very small amount
of things that you absolutely adore.

And whenever you put it on
you feel like a million bucks!
It causes you to be extremely selective
when you go shopping, you have to ensure

that you buy things that
you absolutely love,
even if it's more expensive,

at least you know you're
gonna have it for longer.
Most of the items I have, it varies,
some I've had for six months
because I wear them all the time,

and unfortunately quality
of clothes these days
isn't very good.
And some pieces of clothing I've had
between four and eight years.
If I love something, I will hang on to it
for a very long time (chuckles).

Packing really really
really takes it over you
when you do it properly,

'cause you are pushing
everything in to place.
You have a strategy to do this right.

Everything neatly,
tightly rolled in place.

It's a really big effort,
but worth it, completely.

Not having to drag around
a sh-ton of suitcases.

The final stage often
ends up looking like this.

And everything else fits in here.
But that's essentially it.
Everything that comes on the plane,

mostly electronics and
toothbrush and so forth,
come on the plane with me, here.
And this is all my other stuff.
Headphones come on the plane.
Thick socks come on the plane.
Big jumper comes on the plane.

And also, please don't ask
me about what brands I use

because there's only a few
things that I actually promote,

and I love, but most of
the time I try to show up

for items in particular,
whatever suits me,

so a top, pants that I
know will last a long time.
It is very rarely to do with the brand,

more so just me consciously
shopping for what I know I need.

Honestly, it's just
finding what works for you.

The other advantage of living
this semi-minimalistic way
is that my style evolves constantly.
This is me, like two months ago.
This is me, like two years ago.
This is me a few years ago.
I don't know who I am.
I'm a chameleon, I keep changing styles
and what I feel comfortable in.

So having the ability to
just switch my clothes,
my wardrobe, my entire wardrobe,

in like five pieces of
clothing, is awesome.

Look, I'm still learning
and I'm not amazing.
My boyfriend, for example,

he literally travels
with a small backpack,
that is all he has.
He has perfected this way better than me,
and I try to push my minimalism that far,

and it actually made me feel
really crappy about myself

because I was wearing the
same clothes on repeat,
and it actually drove me insane
because I wanted to mix it up

and feel good about myself
every now and again (chuckles).

So a few months ago, I
just started concentrating

on buying quality and
beautiful pieces of clothing.
And I think this is why I have slowly also

become more and more extra,
'cause my pieces of clothing

are starting to look
almost like pieces of art,

because I put the time and
effort in to buying them,

not just buying something
like, boom, off impulse.

So, please check out my
Instagram if you want to see
how I utilize my small, tiny wardrobe,
to make myself look extra,
woop, ula-bop, a-la-be-bup (laughs).
Hope this was informative.
Please let me know what part of this
was most enlightening to you,
seeing my entire collection of things.

I'm glad you didn't see my,
ah, underwear (chuckles).
And I shall see you next time.

Please subscribe, I would love
to have you part of my tribe,
my family, and until next time, peace.
The day of editing, I am certain
I'm gonna get these questions,
so I'm just gonna address them.
I hand-wash my things, like crazy.
I don't actually need to go the laundry
because I have so few things.
So I hand-wash a lot.
And the more that I watch this video,

the more I realize that
maybe I don't actually have

that much stuff, so I'm,
yeah, it's not very much.

That's why I'm wearing the
same top again (chuckles).

But, I don't really care, it
actually makes me feel good.

And the third thing, I'm
getting a lot of brand deals

inquiring right now, so a lot
of clothing companies as well.
I have nothing against it,

I just need to figure out

have all these clothes,
because I think eventually,

I will wanna have a
house, so download a bit,
have a few extra clothes,

and maybe I'll also do
a lot of give-aways,

so whatever I don't
end up using very much,
I'll just take the photos, you know,

get paid for my work, and

But, I don't know yet, we'll
figure out when that comes.
